items.sentence: Tom\'s experience attracted considerable attention.
It would be good if Tom did a little more exercise.
It would be interesting to see if we could do that.
I asked Tom why he wasn\'t at the party last night.
I assume there\'s somebody somewhere who likes Tom.
I assume you\'ll call me if you need anything else.
Tom can\'t be in Boston. I just saw him in Chicago.
Both my father and my brother work in this factory.
Can you introduce me to a lawyer who speaks French?
Tom certainly has trouble thinking outside the box.
Tom certainly looks like he wants to start a fight.
Tom certainly seems to be more effective than Mary.
Tom tries to do some light exercises every morning.
Tom wants to forgive his father for abandoning him.
I can\'t count the number of times I\'ve been here.
Tom and Mary are probably halfway to Boston by now.
Tom and Mary are putting on their coats and gloves.
Tom and Mary both come from dysfunctional families.
I\'m never going to be given the chance to do that.
Neither Tom nor Mary has anything to be ashamed of.
Don\'t you know that everybody is talking about us?
Don\'t you think what Tom suggested is a good idea?
I suppose you\'ve heard about what happened to Tom.
I suspect that Tom won\'t want to do that tomorrow.
I didn\'t know Tom could play the trombone so well.
I don\'t like pizza any more than I like spaghetti.
I wondered whether Tom told Mary to do that or not.
I wondered whether Tom wanted us to be here or not.
I would advise you strongly to do what Tom advised.
All of us can speak French, so let\'s speak French.
There\'s nothing in here but a lot of useless junk.
There\'s nothing like a dish of homemade ice cream.
There\'s only one place that Tom is likely to hide.
The roads are impassable because of the heavy snow.
Do you think Tom will go swimming with us tomorrow?

My high school French teacher was a native speaker.
Tom finally talked Mary into buying a new computer.
Tom flipped the coin in the air and then caught it.
Tom folded the letter and put it into the envelope.
Tom folded up the newspaper and put it on his desk.
Tom died with over ten million dollars in the bank.
Is it true that Tom can\'t see out of his left eye?
I don\'t really want to play tennis this afternoon.
I don\'t think Tom knows where Mary learned French.
Tom took care of Mary\'s dog while she was in jail.
Tom reluctantly agreed that he wouldn\'t tell Mary.
How are we supposed to manage with so little money?
A six-figure income isn\'t uncommon for physicians.
Mary isn\'t the same woman she was three years ago.
